name: The Gospel Of Mark Quiz | New Testament | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the Bible, Mark is the last of the four gospels.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Mark is the second book of the gospels (although it was probably the first of them to be written). His name means hammer and in Colossians 4:10 it states that Mark is the nephew of Barnabas. The book of Mark holds sixteen chapters making it the shortest of the four gospels.

questions.text: When the book of Mark begins, who is being baptized?
questions.explanation:
Jesus.

	Mark 1:9-12 records Jesus being baptized by John the Baptist in the river of Jordan and God's approval of the baptism.

questions.text: Mark records the gathering of the twelve disciples. Who were the men Jesus made His first two disciples?
questions.explanation:
Peter and Andrew.

	Mark 1:16-18 tells the story of Simon Peter and Andrew becoming Jesus' disciples. Mark 3:13-19 records the names of all twelve disciples.

questions.text: Where was Bartimaeus when he was healed by Jesus?
questions.explanation:
Jericho.

	Mark 10:46-52 records the story of a blind man named Bartimaeus who was outside of Jericho when Jesus and His disciples were leaving the city. Bartimaeus called out to Jesus and Jesus had Bartimaeus brought to Him and Jesus gave him his sight back.

questions.text: What type of tree did Jesus curse when He saw that it didn't have any fruit?
questions.explanation:
Fig.

	In Mark 11:12-14, Jesus was leaving Bethany when He stopped at a flowered fig tree to get something to eat. When He saw the tree had no fruit on it, He cursed it so the tree would never bear fruit again.

questions.text: How many mites did the widow woman give to the treasury?
questions.explanation:
2.

	When Jesus was in the temple of Jerusalem He saw a widow woman put two mites in the treasury. A mite is one-eight of a cent. Jesus told His disciples that the widow woman gave more than anyone because she gave all that she had. This story can be found in Mark 12:41-44.

questions.text: For what occasion did Jesus find a room for Himself and His disciples?
questions.explanation:
Passover.

	On the day of the Passover, Jesus told two of His disciples to follow a man with a pitcher of water and they would find a room to have Passover. The story can be found in Mark 14:13-16.

questions.text: Which three disciples did Jesus take aside in the Garden of Gethsemane?
questions.explanation:
James, John, Peter.

	After they shared their dinner, Jesus went to Mount of Olives to pray and he took Peter, James, and John with Him. While the three disciples waited on Jesus, they fell asleep twice. The story can be found in Mark 14:26-42.

questions.text: After Jesus' death, who claimed the body?
questions.explanation:
Joseph of Arimathaea.

	After Jesus had been taken down from the cross, Joseph approached Pilate about claiming the body. Pilate let him have the body and Joseph had it cleaned and dressed so the body of Jesus could be put into a sepulchre. The story of Joseph and Jesus can be found in Mark 15:43-47.

questions.text: In Mark 16:14-20, what happened to Jesus after His resurrection and meeting with the disciples?
options: He went to see his grieving mother
questions.explanation:
He ascended into Heaven.

	After Jesus was resurrected, He met with the disciples and told them to go out and teach others about Him. Jesus then ascended into Heaven to sit on the right hand of God.
